cho_description:
Darius I , 5th century BC, National Museum of Iran, Tehran

Excavated in 1972 by a french team head by Jean Perrot in Susa, Khuzestan, Iran
Now, the statue without heads, it measure 2.46 meters, and can be calculated that would measure about 3.5 meters if it was whole.
Possibly it was erected in a temple in the city of Pithom, Egypt. Years later, it was moved to place it in the monumental entrance that led to the palace of Susa.
This model was made with 16 photos captured by a single compact Camera with low resolution.

More information:
http://algargosarte.blogspot.com.es/2015/01/dario-i-el-grande-como-faraon-de-egipto.html

Made by Ginza : https://sketchfab.com/ginza
cho_title: Dario I as pharaoh of Egypt / داریوش یکم
